parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Plural
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From asthenes; feebleness; by implication, malady; morally, frailty.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Magdalene, a woman of Magdala. Feminine of a derivative of Magdala; a female Magdalene, i.e. Inhabitant of Magdala.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular

str2: An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
